Most of the sections of the debate were alot of "well you said"s so I thought we could continue from here.
 
 
Originally Posted by fartingle 
 This must be based on an idea like this- the very first living organism was nothing, a formless glob with no organs or various cell parts, yet it had all of its functions to be able to survive, eat, move, and reproduce- because otherwise it would need things. 

 
 
Is there a word for the fallacy which occurs when one pretends to respond to a statement by completly ignoring it and making another assertion?

 
 What I am trying to get accross here is that it either was a completely functioning glob or it (against ludicrous odds) had form, function, and structure all at once.
